us.fihgu.toolbox.http

Class HTTPContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.fihgu.toolbox.http.HTTPContext
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ByteBufferContext, FileContext

    public abstract class HTTPContext
extends java.lang.Object
    a HTTPContext is a resource that's related to a web path
    HTTPContext has a few important properties:
    It is thread safe.
    Any Thread can read from a random position of the resource at any time.
    Author:
    fihgu

      • read

        public abstract long read(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel,
                          long contextPosition)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        read as much bytes as possible, from the resource to the given channel.
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel to write to
        contextPosition - the beginning position to read, inclusive.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes actually read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
